title: Basic Tactics
description: Learn fundamental tactical patterns: forks, pins, and skewers

lessons.title: Knight Fork - King and Rook
lessons.description: White knight can fork the black king and rook

alternatives.feedback: Nc6 doesn't give check. Look for a move that attacks both the king and rook
Nf7+ gives check but doesn't attack the rook

lessons.hint: Move your knight to give check while also attacking the rook
lessons.explanation: Nd7+ is a devastating fork! The black king must move, and then you can capture the rook with Nxa8, winning material.

lessons.title: Knight Fork - King and Queen
lessons.description: Black knight can fork the white king and queen

alternatives.feedback: Nb3 attacks the queen but doesn't give check
Ne2+ gives check but doesn't attack the queen

lessons.hint: Find the square where your knight gives check and attacks the queen
lessons.explanation: Nc2+ forks the king and queen! White must move the king, allowing you to capture the queen with Nxd1.

lessons.title: Bishop Pin
lessons.description: Pin the knight to the king with your bishop

alternatives.feedback: Bf4 develops the bishop but doesn't create a pin
Bd5 is active but doesn't pin anything

lessons.hint: Use your light-squared bishop to attack the knight on f6
lessons.explanation: Bg5 pins the knight on f6 to the black queen on d8. The knight cannot move without exposing the queen to capture.

lessons.title: Rook Skewer
lessons.description: Use your rook to skewer the king and queen

alternatives.feedback: Qa2 doesn't give check. Look for a move that forces the king to move
Qh2+ gives check but doesn't create a skewer

lessons.hint: Give check on the same line as the white rook
lessons.explanation: Qe1+ skewers the king and rook! The king must move, and then you can capture the rook with Qxe1.

lessons.title: Pawn Fork
lessons.description: Use a pawn to fork two pieces

alternatives.feedback: e4 attacks the knight but allows it to simply move away
That's not a legal pawn move - pawns capture diagonally

lessons.hint: Push your central pawn to attack two white pieces at once
lessons.explanation: d4 forks the bishop on c4 and the knight on c3! White cannot save both pieces and will lose material.
